main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects reported in Norfolk, England during the early 1950s.
interesting points: One sighting involved a disk-shaped object emitting a greenish-blue glow, reported by Captain Gamett., The object was visible for about 3-5 minutes and performed erratic maneuvers before disappearing at high speed., A radar intercept indicated an object at 20,000 to 30,000 feet, displaying capabilities difficult for a conventional balloon., Three pilots from the military reported a radar sighting of an object on 4/2/54 with an indicated speed of 2,000 to 3,000 MPH., Objects observed were highly reflective and appeared elliptical from below.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects; disc-shaped object; elliptical objects
witness description: military pilots, Captain Gamett, and other unidentified witnesses
